body_content.explanation: An automatic machine or device is able to operate independently of human control:
An automatic gun is able to keep loading (= adding bullets) and shooting continuously for as long as the trigger is pressed:
examples: The state banned the sale of automatic weapons.
The weapon is capable of firing in either an automatic or a semiautomatic mode.

body_content.explanation: An automatic vehicle or gearbox is one in which the driver does not have to change the gears:
examples: I was thinking of buying an automatic car because my wife has arthritis.
Both 5-speed manual and 4-speed automatic transmissions are available.
For the UK, it will have a four-speed automatic gearbox only.
Over time, driving just becomes automatic.
My automatic response was to pull my hand away.

body_content.explanation: certain to happen as part of the normal process or system:
examples: Citizenship is automatic for children born in this country.
You get an automatic promotion after two years.

body_content.explanation: a vehicle in which you do not have to change the gears:
examples: In the US, most cars are automatics, while in the UK they are still mostly manual.

body_content.explanation: a gun that is able to keep loading (= adding bullets) and shooting continuously for as long as the trigger is pressed:
examples: The gunman opened fire with an automatic.
